headline.print_headline: Ohio Terrorism Suspect Allowed to Remain Free on Bond
headline.main: Ohio Terrorism Suspect Allowed to Remain Free on Bond

snippet: One of four men accused of raising money for a former al-Qaida leader can remain free on bond after it turned out a GPS glitch made it look like he had violated terms of his release, a federal judge in Ohio said Tuesday....
lead_paragraph: One of four men accused of raising money for a former al-Qaida leader can remain free on bond after it turned out a GPS glitch made it look like he had violated terms of his release, a federal judge in Ohio said Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: Public Split Between Concern Over Terrorism and Privacy
headline.main: Public Split Between Concern Over Terrorism and Privacy

snippet: A survey found that 54 percent of the public said they were very or somewhat concerned about the loss of privacy, while 44 percent were not very concerned or not at all concerned....
lead_paragraph: A survey found that 54 percent of the public said they were very or somewhat concerned about the loss of privacy, while 44 percent were not very concerned or not at all concerned.

headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Indonesia Plans Tougher Anti-Terrorism Laws After Jakarta Attack
headline.main: Exclusive: Indonesia Plans Tougher Anti-Terrorism Laws After Jakarta Attack

snippet: Indonesia has drawn up plans for tougher anti-terrorism laws following last month's militant attack on the capital, including detention without trial for up to three months compared with a week now, government sources told Reuters on Tuesday....
lead_paragraph: Indonesia has drawn up plans for tougher anti-terrorism laws following last month's militant attack on the capital, including detention without trial for up to three months compared with a week now, government sources told Reuters on Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: China Rules Out Joining Anti-Terrorism Coalitions, Says Helping Iraq
headline.main: China Rules Out Joining Anti-Terrorism Coalitions, Says Helping Iraq

snippet: China won't take part in any coalition fighting "terrorist groups" in the Middle East, but will do its fair share in its own way and is already helping Iraq, Foreign Minister Wang Yi said on Friday....
lead_paragraph: China won't take part in any coalition fighting "terrorist groups" in the Middle East, but will do its fair share in its own way and is already helping Iraq, Foreign Minister Wang Yi said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Trial for Macedonia Gun Battle Begins, Albanians Deny Terrorism
headline.main: Trial for Macedonia Gun Battle Begins, Albanians Deny Terrorism

snippet: Twenty-nine ethnic Albanians pleaded not guilty on Tuesday to charges of terrorism on the opening day of a trial over a deadly day-long gun battle with police in Macedonia last May....
lead_paragraph: Twenty-nine ethnic Albanians pleaded not guilty on Tuesday to charges of terrorism on the opening day of a trial over a deadly day-long gun battle with police in Macedonia last May.

headline.print_headline: Trump, Turkey's Erdogan Discuss Boosting Ties, Fighting Terrorism: Sources
headline.main: Trump, Turkey's Erdogan Discuss Boosting Ties, Fighting Terrorism: Sources

snippet: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan called U.S. President-elect Donald Trump by phone on Wednesday and discussed improving relations and cooperating in fighting terrorism, sources in Ankara said....
lead_paragraph: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan called U.S. President-elect Donald Trump by phone on Wednesday and discussed improving relations and cooperating in fighting terrorism, sources in Ankara said.

headline.print_headline: Russia Says U.S. Syria Statement Shows Washington Supports Terrorism
headline.main: Russia Says U.S. Syria Statement Shows Washington Supports Terrorism

snippet: Russia is outraged by the threatening tone of the latest U.S. statement on Syria, viewing it as tantamount to supporting terrorism, Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said on Thursday, according to Russian news agencies....
lead_paragraph: Russia is outraged by the threatening tone of the latest U.S. statement on Syria, viewing it as tantamount to supporting terrorism, Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said on Thursday, according to Russian news agencies.

headline.print_headline: Iran Says Will Continue Supporting Syria Against Terrorism
headline.main: Iran Says Will Continue Supporting Syria Against Terrorism

snippet: Iran's President Hassan Rouhani vowed on Tuesday that his country would continue to back Syria in its fight against "terrorism", the semi-official news agency Tasnim reported....
lead_paragraph: Iran's President Hassan Rouhani vowed on Tuesday that his country would continue to back Syria in its fight against "terrorism", the semi-official news agency Tasnim reported.

headline.print_headline: UK Charges Woman With Terrorism Offense Over Turkish Publication
headline.main: UK Charges Woman With Terrorism Offense Over Turkish Publication

snippet: British police said on Tuesday they had charged two people with terrorism offences, including a woman accused of encouraging others to commit a terrorist offense in connection with a publication linked to a Turkish militant group....
lead_paragraph: British police said on Tuesday they had charged two people with terrorism offences, including a woman accused of encouraging others to commit a terrorist offense in connection with a publication linked to a Turkish militant group.

headline.print_headline: Serbia, Bosnian Serbs Hold Joint Anti-Terrorism Drill
headline.main: Serbia, Bosnian Serbs Hold Joint Anti-Terrorism Drill

snippet: Police from Serbia and the Serb mini-state in Bosnia have held a joint anti-terrorism drill that could add to simmering tensions in the Balkans stemming from the 1990s war....
lead_paragraph: Police from Serbia and the Serb mini-state in Bosnia have held a joint anti-terrorism drill that could add to simmering tensions in the Balkans stemming from the 1990s war.
